intro: Miconia longispicata var. minor, commonly known as the small-spined miconia, is a species of flowering plant in the family Melastomataceae. It is native to the tropical regions of South America, particularly Brazil. The plant is characterized by its large, glossy, heart-shaped leaves and clusters of small, white to pinkish flowers. It produces berries that are typically red when mature, containing several seeds. This species is often found in moist, shaded habitats within tropical rainforests.
